item.title: Trump May Weigh In On H-1B Visas, But Major Reform Depends On Congress
item.description: February 28, 2017 - President Trump has said he wants to crack down on abuses and protect American workers. But it's Congress that holds the power to fundamentally reform the program, and work there is underway.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 28, 2017 - President Trump has said he wants to crack down on abuses and protect American workers. But it's Congress that holds the power to fundamentally reform the program, and work there is underway. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/02/28/517496648/trump-may-weigh-in-on-h-1b-visas-but-major-reform-depends-on-congress

item.title: Can Sex Offenders Be Barred From Social Media? Justices Lean Toward No
item.description: February 27, 2017 - The court heard two cases today: One on whether the government can deport a resident for a statutory rape conviction, and another on whether a state can criminalize social media use for sex offenders.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 27, 2017 - The court heard two cases today: One on whether the government can deport a resident for a statutory rape conviction, and another on whether a state can criminalize social media use for sex offenders. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/27/517563127/can-sex-offenders-be-barred-from-social-media-justices-lean-toward-no

item.title: Privacy Paradox: How To Gain More Control Over Your Data
item.description: February 27, 2017 - The WNYC podcast, "Note to Self," conducted an experiment called The Privacy Paradox, which involved thousands of people who tried to strengthen control over their personal information online.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 27, 2017 - The WNYC podcast, "Note to Self," conducted an experiment called The Privacy Paradox, which involved thousands of people who tried to strengthen control over their personal information online. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/27/517563179/privacy-paradox-how-to-gain-more-control-over-your-data

item.title: New FCC Chairman Plans To Block Privacy Regulations
item.description: February 27, 2017 - The Federal Communications Commission's new chairman wants to block a rule approved by his predecessor requiring Internet service providers like Comcast and Verizon adhere to new privacy standards.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 27, 2017 - The Federal Communications Commission's new chairman wants to block a rule approved by his predecessor requiring Internet service providers like Comcast and Verizon adhere to new privacy standards. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/27/517563172/new-fcc-chairman-plans-to-block-privacy-regulations

item.title: North Carolina Law Makes Facebook A Felony For Former Sex Offenders
item.description: February 27, 2017 - North Carolina has a law banning sex offenders from social media. The state says sex offenders use sites to find future child victims. The court will decide if this is constitutional.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 27, 2017 - North Carolina has a law banning sex offenders from social media. The state says sex offenders use sites to find future child victims. The court will decide if this is constitutional. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/26/517086190/north-carolina-law-makes-facebook-a-felony-for-former-sex-offenders

item.title: To Keep Teens Safe Online, They Need To Learn To Manage Risk
item.description: February 27, 2017 - Teens should be included in efforts to mitigate their online risks, researchers say, but apps focus more on parents controlling access by monitoring and blocking sites.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 27, 2017 - Teens should be included in efforts to mitigate their online risks, researchers say, but apps focus more on parents controlling access by monitoring and blocking sites. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/02/27/517491502/to-keep-teens-safe-online-they-need-to-learn-to-manage-risk

item.title: How The Media Are Using Encryption Tools To Collect Anonymous Tips
item.description: February 27, 2017 - Technology has made for more ways to leak scoops to the press than ever before. And newsrooms across the country are taking advantage of that.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 27, 2017 - Technology has made for more ways to leak scoops to the press than ever before. And newsrooms across the country are taking advantage of that. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/02/27/517037537/how-the-media-are-using-encryption-tools-to-collect-anonymous-tips

item.title: The Early 2000s Are Calling: New Nokia 3310 Phones Revealed
item.description: February 26, 2017 - We reported earlier this month on rumors that the Internet's favorite indestructible brick of a phone would be returning to shelves. Now it's official. The not-so-smartphone will cost about $50.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 26, 2017 - We reported earlier this month on rumors that the Internet's favorite indestructible brick of a phone would be returning to shelves. Now it's official. The not-so-smartphone will cost about $50. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/02/26/517377642/the-early-2000s-are-calling-new-nokia-3310-phones-revealed

item.title: FCC Chairman Goes After His Predecessor's Internet Privacy Rules
item.description: February 24, 2017 - The new telecom chief is moving to halt one part of the sweeping rules for Internet service providers, which were passed last year in part based on "net neutrality" regulations.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 24, 2017 - The new telecom chief is moving to halt one part of the sweeping rules for Internet service providers, which were passed last year in part based on "net neutrality" regulations. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/02/24/517050966/fcc-chairman-goes-after-his-predecessors-internet-privacy-rules

item.title: Trump Administration Weighs Increased Scrutiny Of Refugees' Social Media
item.description: February 24, 2017 - The Obama administration began checking social media accounts of prospective Syrian refugees more than a year ago. Such steps could expand as President Trump prepares a new executive order on vetting.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 24, 2017 - The Obama administration began checking social media accounts of prospective Syrian refugees more than a year ago. Such steps could expand as President Trump prepares a new executive order on vetting. http://www.npr.org/sections/parallels/2017/02/24/516867413/trump-administration-weighs-increased-scrutiny-of-refugees-social-media

item.title: Google Spinoff Sues Uber, Saying Leader Of Autonomous Vehicle Unit Stole Key Designs
item.description: February 24, 2017 - Waymo, the company that began as Google's self-driving-car project, says a former manager "took extraordinary efforts to raid Waymo's design server and then conceal his activities."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 24, 2017 - Waymo, the company that began as Google's self-driving-car project, says a former manager "took extraordinary efforts to raid Waymo's design server and then conceal his activities." http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/02/24/517027719/google-spin-off-sues-uber-saying-leader-of-autonomous-vehicle-unit-stole-key-des

item.title: Liz Coleman: How Do We Teach College Students To Ask Big Questions?
item.description: February 24, 2017 - Former Bennington College President Liz Coleman believes higher education is overly-specialized & complacent. She says we need to encourage students to ask bigger questions and take more risks.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 24, 2017 - Former Bennington College President Liz Coleman believes higher education is overly-specialized & complacent. She says we need to encourage students to ask bigger questions and take more risks. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/24/516726045/liz-coleman-how-do-we-teach-college-students-to-ask-big-questions

item.title: Kevin Jones: Can Embracing Uncertainty Lead To Better Medicine?
item.description: February 24, 2017 - Sometimes, doctors just don't have the answers. Surgeon Kevin Jones says having the humility to acknowledge this leads to better medicine.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 24, 2017 - Sometimes, doctors just don't have the answers. Surgeon Kevin Jones says having the humility to acknowledge this leads to better medicine. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/24/516710048/kevin-jones-can-embracing-uncertainty-lead-to-better-medicine

item.title: The Struggles Of Austin's Music Scene Mirror A Widened World
item.description: February 24, 2017 - As the face of Austin's music office prepares to depart, the city's problems and successes may offer a lesson for the world at large about globalization and technology.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 24, 2017 - As the face of Austin's music office prepares to depart, the city's problems and successes may offer a lesson for the world at large about globalization and technology. http://www.npr.org/sections/therecord/2017/02/24/516904340/the-struggles-of-austins-music-scene-mirror-a-widened-world

item.title: Reading The Game: Shadow Of Mordor
item.description: February 24, 2017 - As part of our occasional series on storytelling in video games, we're looking at a game where the story fails: Shadow of Mordor, which won awards for its gameplay, but lacks a compelling narrative.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 24, 2017 - As part of our occasional series on storytelling in video games, we're looking at a game where the story fails: Shadow of Mordor, which won awards for its gameplay, but lacks a compelling narrative. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/02/24/515685000/reading-the-game-shadow-of-mordor
